content: I have been there twice... My idea is that the US.Gov. should take the LTTE off the FTO-List(Terrorist list). This relief would lift the LTTE on a diplomatic platform on witch a peace solution could be found. Why US. Troops? The singhales Army controls a the Tamil - Cities. It is a given fact that there are a lot of crimes committed on Tamil-Civilians. The presents of US. Troops could prevent such a situations.

content: quote: Originally posted by 4246775: Is it possible that US-Gov. could do something for the situation in Sri Lanka? Send troops or react political?... You got an extra Brigade in your pocket? We got troubles on our own border we can't handle and two wars going. Our military and economy is stretched to the breaking point - maybe past. The UN should be handling areas like that. As ugly as it may seem, sometimes things just have to be allowed to take their course. America hasn't got the resources to solve every problem of the planet. The azzhole Iranians, Extremist Islamics, Russians and Chinese will keep fueling these kinds of flash fires all over the world to stretch America, England, and the like ever thinner until we break, if possible. Venezuela and Cuba are certainly acting as puppets of the above goading the problems we have south of us. That's where we have to concentrate now, and problems further away will just have to fall to someone else, or burn themselves out - - Wandering and Wondering

content: In a word, no. No to involving the US in the conflict and absolutely no to legitimizing the LTTE, for the following reasons: * More suicide bombs have been detonated by LTTE members than Al Queda, Hamas and Islamic Jihad combined. * Over 5000 members of the LTTE in the last decade have been children under the age of 15. * The FBI (as of 1/18/08) has listed them as "the most dangerous and deadly extremists in the world", guilty of over 4000 murders (i.e. NOT military casualties, but the crime of murder), ethnic cleansing, and political assasinations. * The LTTE has many phony relief agencies here and abroad to redirect Tsumani relief donations to weapon and explosives procurement. The FBI recently arrested several dozens of people associated with this activity. The LTTE is a terrorist threat to their nation, the stability of the Indian Ocean region, and ultimately a key player in the world terrorist network. Sullivan013

content: The United States has always kicked out the bullies who pick on the little guys. Times have changed, with Iraq and Afghanistan, our military is really taxed. If it hadn't been for France peeing their pants and running off instead of helping us in Iraq. Other countries refusing to get involved, it really puts a strain on our military. Long story, short, some of these other countries are gonna have to get mad and kick the snot out of the bullies! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: quote: Originally posted by 4246775: Is it possible that US-Gov. could do something for the situation in Sri Lanka? Send troops or react political?... First let me welcome you to out happy little forum. You'll find friends here though even friends have teeth. On to your question. There are "situations" all around the world. We're a powerful nation and many look to us for help. We're the good guys and have been trying to help a lot of people around the world. Two things occur to me. first off we spend and help everyone we can and often enough those very same people turn around and spit in our face. Secondly we can no longer afford to be the world's welfare provider. We have our own problems right here and I think we need to take care of ourselves now. Our military is stretched thin as well. Our troops in Iraq and Afghanistan are performing at levels beyond belief with very little rest. I'm sorry if I sound cold hearted but we just can't take on any more right now. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
